intro: Chionolaena costaricensis, commonly known as the Costarica silverleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a low-growing habit with branched stems and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native range.
